result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Patrick Vander Maazen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Patrick Vander Maazen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian Patrick Vander Maazen was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,800.00 fine/cost to be paid to Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on August 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on August 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Patrick Vander Maazen
